entry.title: overall bitcoin client code quality
entry.summary: The author of the email, Michael Offel, is requesting a discussion about code quality in order to create a plan for cleaning up the Bitcoin codebase. He identifies several areas that need improvement, including poor documentation, lack of module isolation and defined interfaces, poor use of threads, long build times, lack of readability in the style guide, and hardcoded values. Offel suggests a complete rewrite of the code but acknowledges that this would be too large of a task for one person. Matt, who responds to the email, agrees with Offel's assessment of the code and identifies cleaning up the code as a high priority, but notes that there are other issues that also need to be addressed.
